alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 11:09AM CST until February 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Snow Continuing Into the Afternoon... .Bands of snow will continue into the afternoon with visibility reduced to less than a mile in heavier snow. As of 1030 AM, 1.5 inches had been reported at Platteville. Some roads are slick or snow-covered. A sharp decrease in snowfall amounts is expected on the northern edge of the band, located across Clayton County, Iowa and Grant County, Wisconsin. If you must travel this afternoon, check conditions before heading out and drive with caution. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with a few locally higher amounts possible across southern Grant County. * WHERE...In Iowa, Clayton County. In Wisconsin, Grant County. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
